questions.answer_description: The Phase 1 of DITSCAP C&A is known as Definition Phase. The goal of this phase is to define the C&A level of effort, identify the main C&A roles and responsibilities, and create an agreement on the method for implementing the security requirements. The Phase 1 starts with the input of the mission need. activity.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: AC
During the Definition Phase (Phase 1) of DITSCAP C&A, negotiations between the organization and various stakeholders take place to identify the extent of security measures that will be implemented in a given system. Similarly, documenting mission needs is necessary during this phase to clearly define system requirements based on stated objectives and planned use.

Registration process activity is not part of the Definition Phase since it deals with registering information systems for assessment during Phase 2 (Verification). The Initial Certification Analysis process activity also isn't part of this phase because it occurs later in Phase 3 (Validation).

Selected Answer: ABC
Correct Answer: ABC

questions.answer_ET: This phase comprises three process activities: Document mission need Registration Negotiation Answer: D is incorrect. Initial Certification Analysis is a Phase 2
questions.question_text: The Phase 1 of DITSCAP C&A is known as Definition Phase. The goal of this phase is to define the C&A level of effort, identify the main C&A roles and responsibilities, and create an agreement on the method for implementing the security requirements. What are the process activities of this phase? Each correct answer represents a complete solution. Choose all that apply.
Which of the following NIST Special Publication documents provides a guideline on network security testing?

discussion.content: A. NIST SP 800-42 "Guideline on Network Security Testing" (Withdrawn on September 30, 2008. Superseded by SP 800-115)

Selected Answer: A
A. NIST SP 800-42

questions.answer_ET: Explanation: NIST SP 800-42 provides a guideline on network security testing. Answer: E, D, B, F, and C are incorrect. NIST has developed a suite of documents
questions.answer_description:
for conducting Certification & Accreditation (C&A). These documents are as follows: NIST Special Publication 800-37: This document is a guide for the security certification and accreditation of Federal Information Systems. NIST Special Publication 800-53: This document provides a guideline for security controls for
Federal Information Systems. NIST Special Publication 800-53A. This document consists of techniques and procedures for verifying the effectiveness of security controls in Federal Information System. NIST Special Publication 800-59: This document is a guideline for identifying an information system as a National Security
System. NIST Special Publication 800-60: This document is a guide for mapping types of information and information systems to security objectives and risk levels.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
2Mosaic by Fabien Petitcolas employs a so-called "presentation attack" primarily against images on a Website. 2Mosaic attacks a digital watermarking system by chopping an image into smaller subimages. On the Website, the series of small images are positioned next to each other and appear the same as the original large image (Petitcolas 2003).

https://www.garykessler.net/library/fsc_stego.html

questions.answer_description:
2Mosaic is a tool used for watermark breaking. It is an attack against a digital watermarking system. In this type of attack, an image is chopped into small pieces and then placed together. When this image is embedded into a web page, the web browser renders the small pieces into one image. This image
Gifshuffle is used to hide message or information inside GIF images. It is done by shuffling the colormap. This tool also provides compression and encryption.
questions.question_text: Which of the following tools is used to attack the Digital Watermarking?
questions.answer_ET: looks like a real image with no watermark in it. This attack is successful, as it is impossible to read watermark in very small pieces. Answer: D is incorrect.

questions.question_text: You and your project team have identified the project risks and now are analyzing the probability and impact of the risks. What type of analysis of the risks provides a quick and high-level review of each identified risk event?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
B. Qualitative risk analysis. This type of analysis prioritizes risks according to their likelihood and potential impact on the project objectives, without quantifying them numerically. It provides an opportunity for subjective judgments from stakeholders to inform the process and help frame subsequent steps in risk response planning. A quantitative risk analysis involves numerical estimates, simulations or modeling techniques for a more rigorous examination of project risks; while a probability-impact matrix considers both probability (likelihood) and impact (consequence), typically using a four-quadrant chart that makes it easy to visualize and prioritize risks. The seven-risk responses are associated with the process of dealing with risks once they have been analyzed as part of a broader Risk Management Plan.

Selected Answer: B
B. Qualitative risk analysis

questions.answer_description: Qualitative risk analysis is a high-level, fast review of the risk event. Qualitative risk analysis qualifies the risk events for additional analysis.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
Integrated change control is the process of reviewing all change requests within a project, analyzing those requests and implementing approved changes. Through integrated change control, project managers may have a more organized structure for changing a project. They can also determine the effects of a proposed change before implementation, allowing them to make better decisions for the project.

https://www.indeed.com/career-advice/career-development/integrated-change-control

 Integrated Change Control ensures that all proposed changes are evaluated based on their impact to overall project objectives and that appropriate approvals are obtained before the changes can be implemented. This helps to ensure that the security posture of a system does not degrade as a result of any change in project scope.

questions.answer_description: The change management system is comprised of several components that guide the change request through the process. When a change request is made that will affect the project scope. The Configuration Management System evaluates the change request and documents the features and functions of the change on the project scope.
questions.question_text: What component of the change management system is responsible for evaluating, testing, and documenting changes created to the project scope?
